intro: Alyxia capitellata, commonly known as the Florida holly, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a small shrub that typically grows in wetlands and swampy areas. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves and produces clusters of small, white flowers. Alyxia capitellata is part of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in moist environments.
